Requirement: A single one-handed melee weapon without the Heavy, Special, or Unarmed traits.

Holding your off-hand close to the torso, you turn your body to the side to make your body less of a target to opponents. Staying light on your feet to make up for your lack of defense, you place your weapon out front, ready to fend off any attacker.

Pros

Minor Multi-attack

  • When you make an attack action, you can attack again as a minor action.
Form Factor
  • For every weapon damage die size lower than 1d10, you have +1 to hit.
Deflect
  • If an opponent that you can see misses you with a melee attack, you can immediately move 5ft without evoking an opportunity attack from your attacker as a non-action.

Cons

Imprecision

  • If you have disadvantage on an attack, you deal half damage with the attack.
Deulist Blindspot
  • While at least one other enemy creature is within 5ft of you, an attacker has a +3 to hit you.
